DOC.HEAD: Man Steals Car, Abandons Toddlers in Freezing Temperatures
DOC.TEXT: A man stole a car and then abandoned two toddlers that had been left in it, leading police to search with cars and a helicopter, authorities said. The boys, ages 2 and 4, were found about two hours later, frightened but OK. Temperatures were below freezing when they were dropped off in a large city park Saturday. ``That's the most low-down car thief I've ever heard of,'' said Detective Roberto Garza. ``Those two little children could have frozen to death in that dark park, but he just drove away and left them there.'' The boys' mother, Araceli Delgadillo, told police she had parked at a grocery store and had left the engine running. She said she had told the boys to lock the door behind her. When she returned after 20 minutes, the car and her sons were gone. Police used patrol cars and a helicopter to search for the missing children. A volunteer found the boys shivering in the park about 6 p.m. No one has been arrested.
